item.title: Satellite Images Show North Korea Boosting Arms Flow to Russia
item.description: North Korea and Russia are deepening their military cooperation, as Pyongyang ramps up the supply of arms to Moscow for its war in Ukraine and receives much needed cash and oil from the Kremlin in return.

item.title: Xi Digs In With Top-Down Economic Plan Even as China Drowns in Debt
item.description: As Beijing braces for a new showdown over trade, Xi Jinping is digging in on economic policies aimed at making China the world’s most powerful country.

item.title: Trump Threatens to Take Control of Panama Canal, Greenland
item.description: The president-elect’s provocative comments about the canal drew an angry rebuke from Panama’s president.

item.title: U.S. Navy Shoots Down Own Plane as Fresh Strikes Target Houthi Rebels in Yemen
item.description: Two U.S. Navy pilots ejected from their jet fighter over the Red Sea after being caught in “an apparent case of friendly-fire,” U.S. Central Command said.

item.title: A Visual Guide to Syria's Long Struggle for Freedom
item.description: The Middle Eastern country had been ruled by outside powers and dictators for centuries before its revolution was realized.

item.title: The Safaris and Carbon-Credit Projects Threatening the Serengeti's Maasai
item.description: Tanzania’s government is evicting tens of thousands of traditional herders from breathtaking natural habitats.

item.title: Ukraine Bets a Free Market for Weapons Production Can Out-Innovate Russia
item.description: While Russia is mass-producing machinery at state-owned industries, Ukraine has spawned hundreds of entrepreneur-led defense startups by slashing regulation and cutting taxes.

item.title: Rickey Henderson, Baseball's All-Time Stolen Base Leader, Dies at Age 65
item.description: The Hall-of-Fame outfielder stole 1,406 bases in his 25-year major league career and was one of the most colorful characters ever to play the game.

item.title: Suspect in German Christmas Market Ramming Had One Main Enemy: Islam
item.description: The 50-year-old psychiatrist, detained after an attack that left at least five people dead, is a well-known anti-Islam activist who seems to have felt increasingly persecuted by Germany.

item.title: The West Auditions Syria's New Leaders
item.description: Senior U.S. diplomats visit Damascus, as Washington and Brussels weigh lifting sanctions against the country’s transitional government.

item.title: Russia Taps Soviet-Era Stockpiles as Armored-Vehicle Supply Dwindles
item.description: Moscow has stepped up efforts to refurbish old equipment, including Soviet-era tanks used as props in films, after losing an estimated 11,000 armored combat vehicles in the Ukraine war.

item.title: The Global Hunt for Putin's 'Sleeper Agents'
item.description: A quiet suburban mom, a hard-drinking war correspondent and an Arctic researcher were hiding in plain sight, championed by the Kremlin’s No. 1 fan of spy fiction.

item.title: Suspected Christmas Market Attacker Was Anti-Islam Activist
item.description: A driver rammed a car into a Christmas market in the eastern German town of Magdeburg, leaving at least two dead and more than 60 wounded.

item.title: Canada's Trudeau Is Losing Grip on Power as Allies Turn Against Him
item.description: The prime minister is facing a storm of criticism over his policies and unpopularity.

item.title: Currency Tailspin Forces Brazil's Leader to Do the Unthinkable: Cut Spending
item.description: Brazil’s currency plunged to its lowest level in 30 years after breakneck spending on pensions and social services.

item.title: Eight People Convicted in Trial for Beheading of French Teacher
item.description: Samuel Paty was killed in 2020 in a Paris suburb after showing caricatures of Islam’s Prophet Muhammad in class as part of a lesson on free speech.

item.title: Brevity of Some Pelicot Rape Trial Sentences Is French-Style Justice
item.description: Legal systems in Europe are often geared toward rehabilitation than punishment, but the length of some of the sentences in the trial surprised many.

item.title: Elon Musk Shook Up U.S. Politics. Will the U.K. Be Next?
item.description: Musk has already helped propel Donald Trump into the White House. Now he might have his sights on another iconic address: 10 Downing Street.

item.title: The Search for Missing Flight MH370 Is Back On
item.description: Malaysia plans to authorize a private robotics company to renew its search for the passenger jet that vanished a decade ago.

item.title: China Tells Chief Economists: Be Positive, or Else
item.description: Experts at leading brokerages say they are hewing closer to the official government line in response to signs of tighter monitoring.
